Platform

Erasmus Mundus Lascala Master “Large Scale Accelerators and Lasers”


Due to internal issues, we are unfortunately unable to open the LASCALA programme in September 2025. We sincerely apologize to all applicants and thank you for your interest. We hope to welcome you in 2026!

Programme overview

The LASCALA master is a two-year international master’s programme, created by 4 leading European universities, that aims at training experts in the most advanced experimental and theoretical tools and concepts in accelerators physics, high power lasers, laser plasma interaction at high intensity, as well as in their applications related to new sources of energy, health, and security diagnostics.

Calendar

Why study in the LASCALA master?

Mobility experience in up to 4 European universities

Winter schools in large-scale facilities

Double or multiple diploma

6-month research internship

Summer school in management of big science projects

Large international network

Discover our universities

The LASCALA master is proposed by a consortium of 4 European universities. This collaboration broadens the panel of expertise, the teaching workforce, and the access to technological platforms.

General description

A two-year master in Large Scale Accelerators and Lasers

The LASCALA master aims at training experts in the most advanced experimental and theoretical tools and concepts in accelerators, high power lasers and associated advanced sources, as well as in their applications for science and society. The LASCALA master was created in the frame of the European university alliance for Global Health - EUGLOH , coordinated by Paris-Saclay University, with Lund University and the University of Szeged as partners. The students will be ready to develop innovative ideas and enterprises related to large scale facilities. This course addresses an increasing demand for highly skilled scientists and engineers ready to contribute to this adventure and enter the job market with solid skills.

The programme includes classes, tutorials, project- and research-based trainings. Students will take advantage of seminars by international speakers, up-to-date technology demonstrations, as well as visits and practices on large scale facilities (e.g. Synchrotron SOLEIL, Pettawatt laser APOLLON, Proton Therapy Centre of Orsay, Lund Laser Centre, MaxIV synchrotron, ELI-ALPS laser facility, SPARC particle accelerator, FLAME multiterrawatt laser, CERN, etc.)

Students must complete their training with a 6-month internship in the academic sector or in the industry.

An intensive summer school also fosters the students' entrepreneurial skills including economy management, communication, patent law, and technology transfer courses so they can face the job market.

The strong partnership with SMEs and research & innovation centres allows the students to strengthen their professional skills and build their international network.

Partner universities

The LASCALA master is based on the excellence of the four partner institutions. All universities are active partners of large-scale facilities at the European level such as accelerators, synchrotrons, and lasers.

Degree-awarding members of the consortium

Paris-Saclay University

  • 14th in the world & 9th in Physics (ARWU ranking)
  • 48,000 students & 9,000 master’s students
  • 4,600 PhD students
  • 13% of French research potential

Sapienza University of Rome

  • 29th in the world in Physics (ARWU ranking)
  • 112,000 students & 21,000 master’s students
  • 7,000 international students
  • 3,000 PhD
  • High-level research centres (INFN)

University of Szeged

  • 1st in Hungary (QS ranking)
  • Ranked #510 in the world (QS ranking)
  • 21,000 students
  • 4,000 international students
  • Unique European laser research centre (ELI-ALPS)

Lund University

  • 85th in the world, 2nd in Sweden (QS ranking)
  • 40,000 students
  • 7,000 international students
  • 2,700 PhD students
  • World-class research facilities (MAX IV and ESS)

Associated partners

The LASCALA consortium also involves associated partners that contribute to guarantee the academic excellence and relevance of the training for the job market.

Benefit from a full immersion research experience with practicals in research labs, winter schools, on-site visits, seminars and internships proposed by our partners:

Companies
+

Thales (France) https://www.thalesgroup.com/en

Amplitude (France) https://amplitude-laser.com/

+

Mobility and degrees

Get up to three diplomas in two years!



At the end of the two years, LASCALA students will get a double or multiple diploma built on the following accredited national master degrees :

  • Master in Physics of Paris-Saclay University
  • Master in Photonics of Lund University
  • Master in Physics of Szeged University
  • Master in Physics of La Sapienza University

For example, a student who studied the first semester at Paris-Saclay University, the second semester at Lund University and the third semester at Szeged University, will get the three master’s degrees from those universities.

1 academic semester = 1 diploma !

Course catalogue

Create your own master’s programme by choosing between the different specializations of our partner universities.

LASCALA Academic Programme

Semester 1
Semester 2
Summer School
Semester 3
Semester 4

Semester 1

Paris-Saclay University - Fundamentals and methods for LASCALA
+

Compulsory courses (31,5 ECTS):

  • Quantum solid State Physics (8 ECTS)
  • Mathematics and statistical methods (to the big data processing) (3 ECTS)
  • Experience in laboratories (large scale facilities at Paris-Saclay) (6 ECTS)
  • Nuclei (3,5 ECTS)
  • Atoms, Molecules, Optics (5 ECTS)
  • European history of science and its role on building EU values (3 ECTS)
  • Summer school (3 ECTS)

Additional course for students in La Sapienza semester 2

  • Particles (3,5 ECTS)

Additional course for students in Lund semester 2

  • Lasers (3,5 ECTS)

Semester 2

Option 1: La Sapienza (33 ECTS) - Particle physics, accelerators
+

Compulsory courses (21 ECTS):

  • Physics Laboratory II
  • Particle physics (6 ECTS)
  • Detectors and accelerators in particle physics (6 ECTS)

2 optional courses to be chosen (12 ECTS):
  • Methods in experimental particle physics (6 ECTS)
  • Accelerator Physics and relativistic electrodynamics (6 ECTS)
  • Plasma Physics and Nuclear Fusion (6 ECTS)
  • Optics (6 ECTS)
  • Laser fundamental (6 ECTS)
  • Advanced Machine Learning for Physics (6 ECTS)
  • Computer Architecture for Physics (6 ECTS)
  • Nuclear physics (6 ECTS)

Option 2: Lund University (30 ECTS)- Atomic physics, intense lasers Neutron source and synchrotron
+

Compulsory courses (15 ECTS):

  • FFFN25 - Optoelectronics and optical communications (7,5 ECTS)
  • FAFN10 - Advanced Optics and lasers (7,5 ECTS)

2 optional courses to be chosen (15 ECTS):
  • FAFN05 - Light matter interaction (7,5 ECTS, LP3)
  • FBRN10 - Biophotonics (7,5 ECTS, LP4)
  • EXTQ4 - Modern X-Ray physics, diffraction and imaging (7,5 ECTS, LP3)
  • EITN 80 - Electro dynamics (7,5 ECTS, LP4)
  • EXTN95 - Accelerator and free electron lasers (7,5 ECTS, LP3)

Summer School (3 ECTS included in the SEM 1)

TOSCA by LASCALA - Techniques of Oversight in SCientific project Administration
+

Place : European Scientific Institute, Archamps (France)

Date: Agust 2025

The TOSCA Summer School aims to introduce students to the management of big science projects.

The school focuses on the main tools for developing, implementing, managing and monitoring a project through dedicated courses:

  • Governance, organization & structure
  • Costing & financing
  • Procurement: specification, tendering and contracts
  • Schedule, reporting and tracking
  • Quality assurance & inspection
  • Knowledge & technology transfer, IP
  • Environmental impact & sustainability
  • Information, communication & outreach

Highly experienced professionals will share their knowledge and experience in a series of talks and seminars on key aspects of project management and how they are implemented in real large-scale scientific projects.

Semester 3 (30 ECTS)

Option 1 : Paris-Saclay university – Tokamak, Hight power laser, and accelerator physics
+
Download the Syllabus file

Compulsory courses (12 ECTS):

  • Transverse high technologies (high vacuum, cryogeny, supraconductivity) (3 ECTS)
  • Management of large scale installations (2 ECTS)
  • Numerical methods (3 ECTS)
  • Practical on large scale facilities at Paris-Saclay - 8 days (4 ECTS)

1 optional course + speciality + winter school (up to 18 ECTS):

  • Tokamak physics (winter school CELIA Bordeaux / JUAS / Walkeyrie)
  • High power laser physics (winter school in CELIA Bordeaux / Walkeyrie)
  • Accelerator physics (winter school in JUAS / ESI)
Download Syllabus for winter schools

Option 2: University of Szeged - Femto- and attosecond physics
+
Download the Syllabus file

  • Selected topics in femto- and attosecond pulse phenomena (4 ECTS)
  • Femtosecond physics with Python (3 ECTS)
  • Fundamentals of femtosecond and nonlinear optics (3 ECTS)
  • Scalar diffraction theory and its applications (5 ECTS)
  • Theory and detection of gravitational waves by laser interferometric instruments (5 ECTS)
  • Weekly practice work at the ELI facility (10 ECTS)

Semester 4 (30 ECTS)

Internship and master thesis

Master thesis charter of rules – 2025

The master thesis project is an essential component of the students' training, both from the point of view of training and skill assessment. The master thesis project takes place over 4,5 months minimum and 6 months maximum, during the fourth semester, and is worth 30 ECTS. The starting date will depend on the track chosen by the student, from mid-January to mid-March and will end, at the latest, on 31 August. It can be carried out in a research lab of the associated partner institutions or companies who have submitted a thesis proposal/internship offer on the Lascala website or in another place.

Master thesis

During the last semester of the programme, students are required to complete a final internship

Examples of master thesis:

Paris-Rome-Paris
Paris-Lund-Szeged

Paris-Rome-Paris

Italy
+

  • Frascati - INFN
    • Beam dynamics Simulations for Eupraxia Project

France
+

  • Orsay - IJCLab
    • Simulation of the superconducting accelerating cavity behaviour (Matlab/Simulink, embedded system)
    • Multi-zone plasma target development
  • Marseilla - PIIM Marseille
    • Study of negative-ion surface production and extraction in low-pressure plasmas: application to fusion
  • Paris - Hopital Gustave Roussy / THERYQ
    • Vers un faisceau d'électrons FLASH mini-beam: design d'un applicateur dédié et caractérisation

Germany
+

  • Munich - Max Planck Institute IPP Garching
    • Investigation of the influence of hydrogen retention on the mechanical properties of tungsten for usage in Tokamaks
    • Characterization and commissioning of an upgraded high-spatial resolution "zoom" radiometer for the study of dynamic behaviour of electron temperature and its perturbations in W7-X
  • Darmstadt - GSI Helmholtzzentrum für Schwerionenforschung
    • Electromagnetic model simulation on Super-FRS SC steering dipole magnet and Cryogenic analysis of Super-FRS SC multiplet
  • Hamburg - DESY
    • Plasma Acceleration in HOFI Waveguides

Spain
+

  • Valencia - Institute of Materials Science at the University of Valencia (ICMUV)
    • Modelling ultra-high accelerating gradients in carbon-based nanostructures through an effective plasma-density approach

Sweden
+

  • Lund - Lund Laser Center
    • Spatial beam shaping for femtosecond laser pulse post-compression

Switzerland
+

  • Geneva - CERN
    • Impedance studies of LHC interconnect modules
    • LHC optics optimization

USA
+

  • California - Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (LBNL)
    • Modeling and Simulation of interaction point in electron-positron colliders with WarpX code

Paris-Lund-Szeged

Israel
+

  • Rehovot - Weizmann Institute
    • Forced Low Intensity Photon-Photon Interaction in Spin-Considered Rydberg Gases

France
+

  • Orsay - Laboratoire de Physique des Solides, Laboratoire LUMIN
    • Hybrid perovskites under biaxial deformation
  • Palaiseau - Laboratoire d’Optique Appliquée
    • High harmonic generation in semiconductor and petahertz electronics
  • Palaiseau - Institut Polytechnique de Paris, Laboratoire d’Optique Appliquée (LOA)
    • Quantum nature of harmonic emission in solid
  • Palaiseau - C2N - Centre for nanoscience and nanotechnology
    • Photonic integrated electro-optic devices in the mid-infrared wavelength range
  • Palaiseau - ONERA
    • Amplification of a pulsed laser in a Ho:YLF crystal at 2.05μm for DIAL lidar:simulation and experimental validation

Colombia
+

  • Medellín - Universidad de Antioquia
    • Validation of the Photon Detection and Readout Electronics in the Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) using a System-on-module (SOM)

Spain
+

  • Salamanca - CLPU
    • Design, implementation and characterization of an imaging optic for ultrafast X-ray Pulses

Sweden
+

  • Lund - Lund University
    • Goniometric investigation of scattering from moths wings in near infrareds
    • Spatio-temporal characterisation of a high-power OPCPA laser

Competences and employment

Students will be able to apply for high-level PhD programmes and to pursue a career in academic or independent research centres, or to envisage a career as engineers and managers in the industrial research and development, in the fields of emerging technologies.

More specifically the competencies and learning outcomes acquired with this master will be:


  • Knowledge of the most advanced concepts and tools in accelerator physics, lasers and laser plasma interaction and their applications in energy, medicine or security diagnosis. For example, students will gain the necessary knowledge to design and operate an hybrid machine such as a laser plasma accelerator (a very compact accelerator compared to conventional ones), a free electron laser seeded by optical laser (this is done to increase the temporal stability and robustness of the light source), or a proton therapy centre;
  • Basic knowledge in data science applied to the above-mentioned fields;
  • Knowledge of the topmost research facilities and industrial sites in the European Union;
  • Competencies in using a scientific approach to problem solving in fundamental research or for applications;
  • Ability to gather and organise relevant information and to critically scrutinize the result of one’s’ own work;
  • Skills in literature searching and writing reports and articles;
  • Knowledge in science management and business, entrepreneurial skills;
  • Communication skills for developing networks at an international level with academics and companies (SMEs, large companies);
  • Critical thinking, creativity and risk-taking.

Lascalian Alumni

What are they doing after graduation?


After 2 years as master students, the newly graduated LASCALA students decided to continue their careers in different directions either in academia or in the industry.


90% of our students have found a position.
75% of them obtained a PhD in European laboratories and abroad:

  • ELI-ALPS (Hungary),
  • CNRS (France),
  • INFN (Italy),
  • ICFO (Spain),
  • Instituto Superior Técnico (Portugal),
  • University of Ljubljana (Slovenia),
  • University of Manchester (United Kingdom),
  • University of Kansas (United States),
  • SPINTEC (France),
  • University of Liverpool (United Kingdom),
  • QUASAR Group (United Kingdom),
  • Max Planck Institute (Germany),
  • LOA – ENSTA (France),
  • Università di Padova (Italy).


15% of them work currently as engineer:

  • Vacasa (Czech Republic),
  • CLPU (Spain),
  • CNRS (France).


(Statistics based on the feedback from the 1 first classe from 2021 to 2023)

What country are they coming from?


Since its opening in September 2021, the LASCALA Master has trained more than 80
students from more than 40 countries.

Admission criteria

The academic year within the LASCALA master starts at the very beginning of September. In order to be able to join us in September, applicants should at least graduate at the end of the academic year (e.g. June, July or August). The proof of the Bachelor degree (diploma or certificate) will be required for enrolment at the university.

Admission criteria
Applicants should have or should be in process to get a Bachelor degree in Physics (basic or applied physics), engineering and related topics (optics, nuclear, photonics,…), corresponding to 180 ECTS, at the time of the application.
PhD students and PhD holders are not eligible.
The criteria and respective weights are the following
50% Academic (and professional when relevant) workloads (including appropriateness of the curriculum, grades.
20% Motivation and professional project
15% Recommendation letter
10% English proficiency
5% Involvement in associations, networks or any other extra-curricular activities showing personal leadership and dynamic abilities
Mobility path
Applicants’ mobility choices are considered in the selection process by the Consortium.
Professionally well-founded requests for mobility changes for the second semester (to be deposited in September) and for the third semester (to be deposited in January) will be considered, but they will be granted only in exceptional cases, pending on the number of students committed for each location.

Tuition fees

Important Announcement – LASCALA Programme

Due to internal issues, we are unfortunately unable to open the LASCALA programme in September 2025. We sincerely apologize to all applicants and thank you for your interest. We hope to welcome you in 2026!

TUITION FEES (FROM THE CLASS OF 2025-2027 - ERASMUS MUNDUS)

The tuition fees must be paid in full at the beginning of each academic year.



European students
Non-European students
Price
Mobility 1 - Paris-Saclay / La Sapienza / Paris-Saclay / Internship 1 850 € / year
Mobility 2 - Paris-Saclay / La Sapienza / Szeged / Internship
Price
Mobility 1 - Paris-Saclay / La Sapienza / Paris-Saclay / Internship 1 850 € / year
Mobility 2 - Paris-Saclay / Lund / Paris-Saclay / Internship
Mobility 3 - Paris-Saclay / Lund / Szeged / Internship

Internship Lund University (SEM4): Additional tuition fees will be payed by non-European students to carry out an internship at one of Lund University's facilities. Non-European students will pay €7400 registration fees for semester 4 directly to the Lund University administration according to their own rules.

800€/month

In addition, students must think about travel and visa costs.

Scholarships

The LASCALA master’s program recruits students from around the wolrd, and admission is very competitive. Discover our scholarships!

Erasmus mobility scholarship
+

Semester
Internship
  • Semester 2 at Lund: 480€/month
  • Semester 2 at La Sapienza: 420€/month
  • Semester 3 at Szeged: 360€/month

Please, note that applications for scholarships must be made during the 1st semester and are awarded according to the number of scholarships available for the current year.

  • Internship Semester 4 at Lund: 630€/month
  • Internship Semester 4 at La Sapienza: 570€/month
  • Internship Semester 4 at Szeged: 510€/month

Please, note that applications for scholarships must be made during the 1st semester and are awarded according to the number of scholarships available for the current year.

Paris-Saclay Scholarship – IDEX

(about 4 scholarships per year)

+

Financial conditions:

First year: 10 000€.

Second year: 10 000€. In addition, the 6-month internship during semester 4 is paid approximately 550€/month minimum.

A maximum of 1000€ for travel and visa (reimbursement)

No fee waiving

Eligibility criteria

Newly arrived international students, aged 30 and less.

Students should not have stopped their studies during more than 3 years.

Students who have lived in France in the past, within the framework of a mobility programme during their studies (e.g. Erasmus exchange programme...) that did not lead to the award of a degree.

Studies during the semester 1 and 3 must take place at Paris-Saclay University. The scholarship is also given during the semester 2 at Lund but will be stopped during the semester 4 if the internship is done outside the Paris-Saclay area. Other type of funding could be proposed for the semester 4 (Erasmus mobility scholarship for example).

Full scholarship
20 000 €
Other fundings
+

Applicants admitted on a self-financed basis are encouraged to search for external funding as early as possible.

Other fundings
Campus France Scholarships conditions can be very different from one country to another: check with the Campus France office in your country.
National government Scholarship Programmes or National Councils for Science and Technology Especially in Latin America (for ex. CONACYT, CONICYT, COLFUTURO) or China (CSC).
International associations in the field of education
Erasmus+ Master degree loans Erasmus+ Master degree loans allow EU students to apply for support for their master's studies abroad. Find out more information on the Erasmus+ Master loans site of the European Commission.

Application procedure

Applications must be sent through the online application platform. Documents cannot be sent by post or email. Incomplete applications will be rejected.

Important Announcement – LASCALA Programme

Due to internal issues, we are unfortunately unable to open the LASCALA programme in September 2025. We sincerely apologize to all applicants and thank you for your interest. We hope to welcome you in 2026!


Professionally well-founded requests for mobility changes for the second semester (to be deposited in September) and for the third semester (to be deposited in January) will be considered, but they will be granted only in exceptional cases, pending on the number of students committed for each location.



Necessary documents for the application


All documents must be in English.

Only certified translations will be accepted. All documents translated to English must come with a copy of the original document.

Original transcripts of records and degree certificates in French, Swedish, Italian and Hungarian can be accepted.



During the application process, you will have to submit the following information and documents:

CV (2 pages maximum)
+

Mention the precise dates of your studies and experiences (months + year) Education: for each diploma, mention the precise specialization, give your GPA / ranking / distinctions, give a list of the main courses you studied
Professional experience: for internships (or professional experiences), indicate the place of internship, the title and name of your supervisor as well as the subject
Mention your participation in projects, contests or conferences
Mention your prizes / scholarships or any other distinctions
Mention articles or other scientific productions at national or international level
Mention your language and computer skills and certifications
Illustrate your personality traits by describing relevant extracurricular activities you might be involved in

Cover letter (2 pages maximum)
+

Your motivation to join the master: Emphasize why you chose this specific master and why it fits with your academic background; if you already hold a master degree, justify why you want/need to validate a second master; if you stopped your studies, justify why you want/need to be back to studies.

Your career objectives: Explain your professional goals in both short and long-term perspective; specify your wish to apply for a PhD or to enter the job market and precise in which fields.

Your mobility in the programme: Your mobility choices during semesters 2 and 3 must be justified according to your academic background and your career objectives.

Grades and grading system explanation
+

Upload your grades since the first year of your Bachelor studies (including an explanation of the grading system used at your university). Only official, signed and stamped transcripts of records will be taken into consideration. Any other non-official documents will be disregarded. If you already hold a master’s degree, upload both your bachelor’s and your master’s grades.

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree diploma/certificate
+

If you already obtained it

Passport
+

Or identity card for students from the European Union

Proof of your place of residency
+

This can be a certificate from your place of study (e.g. enrolment certificate), work (e.g. contract), or a residence certificate in accordance with your municipality registration, issued less that 12 months before the application deadline.

Proof of english proficiency
+

Note that an applicant from an institution where the language of instruction is English is not required to provide any official test results. In that case, you must upload a document certifying it (transcript of records, letter of your institution, etc.).

In all other cases, the applicant must provide one of the following tests:

TOEFL: Paper Based Test: 550 or higher, Computer Based Test: 213 or higher, Internet Based Test: 82 or higher.

IELTS: 6.0 points or higher

Cambridge Certificates: Cambridge English First (FCE), Cambridge English Advanced (CAE) and Cambridge English Proficiency (CPE).

Recommendation letter on letterhead paper and hand signed
+

Optional

Contact details of a referee
+

Referees should be qualified to assess your scientific knowledge, such as a professor or an internship supervisor. The first referee is mandatory, but the second is optional. When entering the emails in the application form, your referees will automatically receive an email. Be sure to remind them to check their spambox, as it is your responsibility to ensure they respond on time.

You will not be able to submit your application until the letter has been received.

Finally please note that referees must use a valid institutional email address. Letters sent from Gmail, Yahoo, or Hotmail will not be accepted.

Platform

Erasmus Mundus Lascala Master “Large Scale Accelerators and Lasers”


Due to internal issues, we are unfortunately unable to open the LASCALA programme in September 2025. We sincerely apologize to all applicants and thank you for your interest. We hope to welcome you in 2026!

Programme overview

The LASCALA master is a two-year international master’s programme, created by 4 leading European universities, that aims at training experts in the most advanced experimental and theoretical tools and concepts in accelerators physics, high power lasers, laser plasma interaction at high intensity, as well as in their applications related to new sources of energy, health, and security diagnostics.

Calendar

Why study in the LASCALA master?

Mobility experience in up to 4 European universities

Winter schools in large-scale facilities

Double or multiple diploma

6-month research internship

Summer school in management of big science projects

Large international network

Discover our universities

The LASCALA master is proposed by a consortium of 4 European universities. This collaboration broadens the panel of expertise, the teaching workforce, and the access to technological platforms.

Paris-Saclay University

Website of the university

Sapienza University of Rome

Website of the university

University of Szeged

Website of the university

Lund University
